reviews.review: liked the game

Pretty fun game! There's badass scenarios like riding a hovercraft with a gun and taking down helicopters, using traps like Kevin McAlister in an abandoned town filled with zombies, commanding an army of giant ants, and chucking grenades halfway across the map because Gordon Freeman is a stronk boi. 
This is a great game to show your kids too with its pickup-and-play gameplay, and easy to follow story with a clear endgoal. The characters you run across are likable too and are portrayed as selfless heroes, such as Barney, Alyx or Eli. The Gman is mysterious as always, and even the villain, Dr. Breen is hella charismatic with his fancy suit and polite demeanor.
Only downsides are that the weapon variety from HL1 is gone. No Tau Cannon, Gluon Gun, Hivehand, and grenades are the only throwable. The game is overall less strategic than 1 and has longer, more drawn out cutscenes. However, despite taking these missteps, HL2 is a great game to play.

It's definitely overrated. That doesn't mean it's bad, but coming from somebody who doesn't have any nostalgia bias with this game, it was far from the "Best PC Game Ever" (taken from the description) some often knock it up to be. Nonetheless, the story *was* good, and the physics engine used was incredibly ahead of its time and arguably shaped a whole era of gaming. Overrated or not, this is a very important game, and it set a very high standard for future games to reach. Just keep your expectations tempered and don't expect to be blown away.

Clássico e pra mim um dos marcos do PC Gamer, esse jogo trouxe muita gente pra steam e mostrou como um FPS podia ter uma campanha baseada em história que não era simplesmente uma guerra mundial histórica pra muita gente (não que ele tenha sido o primeiro), os gráficos e a jogabilidade pra época também eram destaque, muitos PC nem conseguiam rodar, usar a gravity gun como arma também é sempre muito satisfátorio demais.
Essa análise é mais pra "bater ponto" se você não conhece HL2 devia estar vivendo em uma ilha deserta a anos e se nunca jogou ele, está cometendo um pecado!
----------------
Classic and for me one of the milestones of PC Gamer, this game brought a lot of people to steam and showed how an FPS could have a story-based campaign that wasn't simply a historic world war for many people (not that it was the first) , graphics and gameplay for the time were also outstanding, many PCs couldn't even run, using the gravity gun as a weapon is also always very satisfying.
This analysis is more to "punch the clock" if you don't know HL2 you should have been living on a deserted island for years and if you've never played it, you're committing a sin!

Do I even have to say why this game is good? Half Life 2 absolutely still holds its ground as one of the best single player shooters of the century. The game prefectly mixes in action packed sequences with superb environmental story-telling and a captivating linear storyline that is easy to follow.

What else can be said about this game? One of the greatest FPSs of all time, one of the best overall games of all time. Story, voice acting, graphics, gameplay, etc. are all the absolute pinnacle.
